author: ralexstokes
content: hiya -- this channel is more for consensus light clients -- if you want help with the current geth light client using LES i'd suggest you check in the geth discord; that being said, once we build out beacon chain light clients you will be able to ask for arbitrary parts of the full state at a given point in time; getting an event that address X received some interaction is a bit tricky as you need to be watching the effects of every transaction... you would either want to scan receipts of each execution block, or periodically poll X for some change in state (and possibly binary search backwards to find the block where the change happened)

author: ralexstokes
content: i think status has someone working on a nimbus light client, let me see if i can loop them in

author: ralexstokes
content: i think i'm missing some context to you and <@!646424665572507648> 's conversation but the pubkeys of the validators in a given sync committee are part of the data fed to a light client

author: ralexstokes
content: otherwise you need the full active validator set at a given epoch and the randao mix for that epoch, and then you have to do a bunch of shuffling

author: ralexstokes
content: by providing the "output" of this computation in the `SyncCommittee` data, a light client doesn't have to do all of this work

author: ralexstokes
content: the way the shuffling algo works, you can actually run it for one index and get back the shuffled position, but you still need to know the overall size of the set and the randomness input

author: ralexstokes
content: generally, the sync protocol suggested in the specs repo gives only enough data for some node to follow the finalized header chain; given this header chain, such a node can turn around and ask about "point" queries in a way that can be authenticated against their local view of the chain

author: ralexstokes
content: something i expect us to run into as we dig in here is what exactly we mean by "light", and that there will be a spectrum of client types as we add in various features here or there (a "reorging" light client, a gossip net for light clients, etc.)
